answerText: Confessions[10] This author of Confessions also wrote, "man is born free; and everywhere he is in chains" in The Social Contract.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | Finals 2 | 4 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This work was among the first to focus on an author's personal development. For 10 points each: [10] Name this autobiography that discusses its author's childhood being raised by his father, as well as his relationship with Therese Le Vasseur and his literary career.
